content: virtauksia flows virtauksia hat was originally designed for chemo cap campaigns launched and run by volunteers in finland in early 2010 lack of nice and free lace hat patterns became evident so i decided to give a try myself the stitch pattern is from lesley stanfield s the new knitting pattern number 192 and it has been adjusted to work for both fingering and aran weight cotton yarns both patterns will most probably show nicely with wool yarns as well yarn lighter hat one skein of sandnes garn mandarin petit 100% cotton 50 g / 180 m thicker hat two skeins of garnstudio drops paris 100% cotton 50 g / 75 m gauge lighter hat 25 sts and 32 row in stockinette = 10 cm thicker hat 15 sts and 20 row in stockinette = 10 cm needles lighter hat 40 cm circular needle 2 5 mm or suitable to obtain the gauge set of 5 dpns 2 5 mm or suitable to obtain the gauge thicker hat 40 cm circular needle 5 mm or suitable to obtain the gauge set of 5 dpns 5 mm or suitable to obtain the gauge size adult as the stitch pattern has both lace and rib character the hat fits most depth can be adjusted by increasing brim ribbing or changing the number of pattern repeats or combining these two see tips at the end of the instructions the model hats are designed to cover ears and eyebrows virtauksia hat pattern and photos ©tiiq http //tiiq vuodatus net kiertorata@gmail com page 1 of 3 any commercial use of the pattern is prohibited instructions before you start note that all knitted stitches are knitted through back of the loopexcept yarn overs that are knitted through front of the yarn over loop while making the lighter hat workall row of chart 1 each row is repeated five times in the round while making the thicker hat workonly odd row of chart 1 each odd row is repeated four times in the round work all row of chart 2 in both hats each row is repeated five and four times in the round in lighter and thicker hat respectively lighter hat co 110 sts join to begin working in the round being careful not to twist work p1 k1tbl rib for 6 rounds set up round *p1 knit the next stitch through back and front of the loop p1 k1tbl 9 times knit the next stitch through back and front of the loop k1* repeat * * altogether five times you should now have 120 sts work chart 1 three times work chart 1 row 1 10 once more work chart 2 once cut yarn and pull through the remaining sts fasten_off tightly and weave in ends thicker hat co 88 sts join to begin working in the round being careful not to twist work p1 k1tbl rib for 4 rounds set up round *p1 knit the next stitch through back and front of the loop
